body_html:
If you could find out which atom operation (like add, addmm or mul) is generally slower, then I think that we can look into it.

I run this code on another machine with Nvidia GTX 1050ti on windows 10, and it takes 0.1s per image.
If with 1080, it should be faster. So i think windows 10 is OK with pytorch.
How should i do the tests of those atom operations to find out which is the part that affects?
How about just simply run each fundumental operation in thousands of times in a for loop?
Do you have any suggestions?

body:
>  If you could find out which atom operation (like add, addmm or mul) is generally slower, then I think that we can look into it.

I run this code on another machine with Nvidia GTX 1050ti on windows 10, and it takes 0.1s per image.
If with 1080,  it should be faster. So i think windows 10 is OK with pytorch.
How should i do the tests of those atom operations to find out which is the part that affects? 
How about just simply run each fundumental operation in thousands of times in a for loop?
Do you have any suggestions?
